intro: Echinocactus capricornis var. crassispinus, commonly known as the Crassispine Hedgehog Cactus, is a succulent native to the arid regions of Mexico. It features a compact, globular stem covered in thick, ribbed segments that are adorned with dense, pale-green spines. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers during the summer months, which bloom from the areoles along the stems. It is well adapted to hot, dry climates and requires minimal water once established. Its slow growth rate and distinctive appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
